riri5 package

Submodules

riri5.RIRI5 module

RIRI5: A 3D Turbid medium model adapted from RATP model- simplified for a 5 directions sky turtle

Authors: G. Louarn / D. Combes - Mai 2014

  • Considers diffuse light only (soc / uoc)

  • Considers beam elevations of a minimal hemispheric turtle with 6 faces: 1 vertical direction + 1 elevation ring

  • Considers only beams crossing by voxel diagonals into (x,y) and (y,z) planes : 1 vertical beam + 4 for diagonal beams = 5 directions sampled

  • This imposes a voxel size and a 3D drid respecting : dx = dy = dz/tan(0.4637) = 2*dz

riri5.RIRI5.WhichVoxel(p, origin_grid, na, dxyz)[source]

Determine in which voxel of a 3D grid is located a point ‘p’

Parameters:

  • p (array) – point [x,y,z] to be located

  • origin_grid (array) – grid origin [xorigin, yorigin, zorigin]

  • na (list) – number of voxels per direction : [nx, ny, nz]

  • dxyz (list) – voxel size : [dx, dy, dz]

Returns:

A list of integer corresponding to the voxel ids [x,y,z] in the 3D grid (for Z, id=0 corresponds to the top of the grid/canopy)

riri5.RIRI5.calc_extinc_allray_multi(ls_mlai, ls_triplets_dir, ls_distf, I0, optsky=None)[source]

Calculate light extinction and absoption per species for a series of beams

Parameters:

  • ls_mlai (list) – List of 3D grids for LAI distribution (Leaf Are Index, unit: m2.m-2) per species

  • ls_triplets_dir (list of) – List of list of triplet voxel indices [zz, yy, xx] for the different beam directions considered

  • ls_distf (list) – List of dist_class_teta_f (relative distribution of leaf area in elevation classes) by species

  • I0 (float) – Incoming light (unit: )

  • optsky (string) – Option for diffuse sky, relative light distribution with elevation angle; either ‘soc’ or ‘uoc’

Returns:

  • “res_trans: ” : array

  • ”res_abs_i: ” : list of arrays

riri5.RIRI5.calc_extinc_allray_multi_reduced(ls_mlai, ls_triplets_dir, ls_distf, I0, optsky=None, opt='VXpXmYpYm')[source]

Calculate light extinction and absoption per species for a series of beams, avoiding calculation in empty voxels above the canopy

Parameters:

  • ls_mlai (list) – List of 3D grids for LAI distribution (Leaf Are Index, unit: m2.m-2) per species

  • ls_triplets_dir (list of) – List of list of triplet voxel indices [zz, yy, xx] for the different beam directions considered

  • ls_distf (list) – List of dist_class_teta_f (relative distribution of leaf area in elevation classes) by species

  • I0 (float) – Incoming light (unit: )

  • optsky (string) – Option for diffuse sky, relative light distribution with elevation angle; either ‘soc’ or ‘uoc’

  • opt (string) – A string to indicate which beam direction to be considered; either ‘VXpXmYpYm’ (5 directions) or ‘V’ (vertical beam only)

Returns:

  • “res_trans: ” : array

  • ”res_abs_i: ” : list of arrays

riri5.RIRI5.calc_extinc_ray_multi(ls_vlai, I0, ls_k)[source]

Calculate light extinction and absoption per species for a beam going through a series of voxels

Parameters:

  • ls_vlai (array) – List of partial LAI (Leaf Are Index, unit: m2.m-2) per species for the series of voxels crossed by the beam

  • I0 (float) – Incoming light from the beam angular sector (unit: )

  • ls_k (array) – List of extinction coefficients per species (unitless)

Returns:

  • “res_trans: ” : array

  • ”res_abs_i: ” : list of arrays

riri5.RIRI5.def_na_lims(pattern8, dz_ini, Hmax, opt='3D', unit='cm')[source]

Calculate the number of voxels per direction and the limits of the voxels in a 3D grid respecting the ratio asumption of RIRI5, given a pattern8, dz_ini and Hmax

Parameters:

  • pattern8 (list) – A list of two [x,y] coordinates setting the upper corner and lower corner of the scene/grid

  • dz_ini (float) – targeted dz of the grid, which is then adpated if it does not fit with the ratio asumption

  • Hmax (float) – targeted Hmax of the grid, which is then adpated if it does not fit with the ratio asumption

  • opt (string) – either ‘3D’ for a 3D grid or ‘1D’ for a vertical one dimention grid

  • unit (string) – unit used for input lengths : either ‘cm’ or ‘m’

Returns:

  • “number of voxels” : [nx, ny, nz]

  • ”voxel size” : [dx, dy, dz]

  • ”3 lists of voxel limits” : [xlims,ylims,zlims]

  • ”grid origin” : [xorigin, yorigin, zorigin]

  • ”reference surface of a voxel (m2)”

riri5.RIRI5.disttetaf(mf, sdf, nbs=10000, seed=0)[source]

Distribute leaf angle normal ditribution into discrete regular elevation classes - A python version of ‘dist_tetaf.r’

Parameters:

  • mf (float) – mean elevation (degre)

  • sdf (float) – stadard deviation of the normal distribution (degree)

  • nbs (integer) – number of random drawings to generate de districution

  • seed (integer) – seed number for the random number generator

Returns:

A list with relative leaf area distribution in 9 elevation angle classes : [5,15,25,35,45,55,65,75,85]

riri5.RIRI5.get_ls_triplets(mat, opt='VXpXmYpYm')[source]

List of triplet voxel IDs for all beams in X plane, Y plane and vertical direction

Parameters:

  • mat (array) – a 3D grid of format

  • opt (string) – A string to indicate which beam direction to be considered; either ‘VXpXmYpYm’ (5 directions) or ‘V’ (vertical beam only)

Returns:

A list of 3 lists with voxel indices [zz, yy, xx] of the beams path

riri5.RIRI5.get_tripletVert(x, y, nz)[source]

List of triplet voxel IDs for vertical beams

Parameters:

  • x (integer) – x voxel ID

  • y (integer) – y voxel ID

  • nz (integer) – number of voxels along z in the plane

Returns:

A list of 3 lists with voxel indices [zz, yy, xx] of the beams path

riri5.RIRI5.get_tripletX(xdeb, y, nx, nz, sens='+')[source]

List of triplet voxel IDs for beams in X plane (x,z)

Parameters:

  • xdeb (integer) – initial beam position, ID along x

  • y (integer) – y voxel ID

  • nx (integer) – number of voxels along x in the plane

  • nz (integer) – number of voxels along z in the plane

  • sens (string) – Direction of the diagonal beams with respect to vertical; either ‘+’ or ‘-’

Returns:

A list of 3 lists with voxel indices [zz, yy, xx] of the beams path

riri5.RIRI5.get_tripletY(ydeb, x, ny, nz, sens='+')[source]

List of triplet voxel IDs for beams in Y plane (y,z)

Parameters:

  • ydeb (integer) – initial beam position, ID along y

  • x (integer) – x voxel ID

  • ny (integer) – number of voxels along y in the plane

  • nz (integer) – number of voxels along z in the plane

  • sens (string) – Direction of the diagonal beams with respect to vertical; either ‘+’ or ‘-’

Returns:

A list of 3 lists with voxel indices [zz, yy, xx] of the beams path

riri5.RIRI5.k_teta_DC(mean_incl, elevations=[9.23, 10.81, 26.57, 31.08, 47.41, 52.62, 69.16, 90])[source]

Computes extinction coefficient from mean elevation angle according to SIRASCA model (p210-211, “Crop stucture and light microclimate” book)

Parameters:

  • mean_incl (float) – mean elevation angle of leaves (degree)

  • elevations (list) – list of beam elevation classes to consider for integration (degres); default=elevation for turtle with 46 directions

Returns:

A list of …

riri5.RIRI5.k_teta_distf(teta_beam, dist_class_teta_f)[source]

Computes extinction coefficient for a given beam integrating the ditribution of leaf area of a species into leaf elevation classes

Parameters:

  • teta_beam (float) – Beam elevation with respect to horizontal plane (degree)

  • dist_class_teta_f (list) – relative distribution of leaf area in elevation classes ; 9 classes in degrees, with centers [5,15,25,35,45,55,65,75,85]

Returns:

Calculated extinction coefficient

riri5.RIRI5.rfr_calc_relatif(relI0, a=3.09, b=1.59, c=0, d=1.12, x1=0.0, x2=2.0)[source]

Calculate Red:Far red ratio from relative transmitted PAR - function and parameter values according to Escobar et al (2009) (Agricultural and Forest Meteorology, 149(8), 1244-1253)

Parameters:

relI0 (array) – A 3D grid for relative transmitted PAR radiation

Returns:

  • “res_rfr: ” : array
